GameEffects: The units currently packed into a commander unit
The city a unit occupies if the plot they are on belongs to one
The district a unit occupies if the plot they are on belongs to one
A collection of all plot yield objects.
Collection of all settlements following the religion founded by the player who owns the effect.
A collection of all major players EXCEPT those in the owner's team.
A collection of all teams containing major players EXCEPT the owner team.
An army object that is inferred from the owner rather than the owner itself.
A city object that is inferred from the owner rather than the owner itself.  Useful when stacking limitations are necessary.
A player object that is inferred from the owner rather than the owner itself.  Useful when stacking limitations are necessary.
A unit object that is inferred from the owner rather than the owner itself.  Useful when stacking limitations are necessary.
Gives bonus to pillage buildings.  This is in addition to other plunders and does not depend on the base type provided by the building
Gives bonus to pillage improvements.  This is in addition to other plunders and does not depend on the base type provided by the improvement
Gives bonus base plunder type for pillaging buildings.  Percent adds a percentage
Gives bonus base plunder type for pillaging Improvements.  Percent adds a percentage
Gives bonus base plunder type for pillaging buildings.  Amount sets straight extra, Percent adds a percentage.  Doing both would cause Amount to also be increased by the specified percentage.
Gives bonus base plunder type for pillaging improvements.  Amount sets straight extra, Percent adds a percentage.  Doing both would cause Amount to also be increased by the specified percentage.
Adjusts whether a unit can move into that terraintype.
Removes unit from map for specified number of turns.
This effect does nothing.  It is useful as a placeholder effect while stubbing out modifiers.
Awards an extra belief to a player's religion
Grants a commander with the specified units.  Will replace them with their unique overrides, or upgraded versions if unlocked.
Awards an extra Pantheon to a player
Adjusts the efficiency of producing certain buildings per given resource type.

Adds a purchase efficency for some amount of buildings based on the parameter provided. BuildingType, BuildingTag, and ConstructibleClass are mutually exclusive. If none of those parameters are provided it will apply to all constructibles. If attached to a city, it will only provide the purchace efficiency for that city
This modifier will increase the amount a commander reduces unhappiness
Adjust whether this player can meet distant land civs
Forbid incorporate a city state into the player's empire
Adjust the number of free great person points.
When you incorporate a city state into the player's empire retain their units
Sets a player up to be able to send trade routes over deep water.
Adds a purchase efficiency for repairing constructibles
Effect that adjusts whether or not a town is allowed to purchase additional constructibles that have a specific tag that is provided by arguments.
Apply a combat bonus based on the number of actions in a diplomacy action group type the player has.
Effects the movement point cost or range of BOTH coastal raiding and pillaging. If you want it to only affect land units' pillaging use REQUIREMENT_UNIT_DOMAIN_MATCHES
Apply area damage amount to unit. This amount will be used when using an area damage ability
Apply a plot effect to the map tile when this unit attacks. Only one plot effect per tile. This one may be overriden by a more powerful effect
Adjust capture properties of a unit
This adjust the combat strength based on bordering 2 or more enemy units
Modifier bonus for killing a unit from previous engagement
Apply a combat bonus to a focused attack type.
Game Effect for adjusting a unit's resistance to water damage
This adjust the combat strength based on nearby units
Adds a purchase efficency for some amount of units based on the parameter provided. If UnitTag is supplied, it will only apply to that type of unit. Otherwise it will apply to all units.
Apply a combat bonus based on the number of relationships of a type the player has.
Apply a combat bonus based on the number of resources of a class the player has.
Game Effect for adjusting a unit's resistance to WMD detonations and subsequent fallout
Apply a combat strength modifier, based on the war support a player has. The amount arg is multiplied by each positive support token.
Game Effect for adjusting a unit's resistance to water damage
Adjusts free war support given to the owning player.
Adjusts specified yeld(s) for ally of the current player.
Sets the player to have met the other players, without triggering a first meet event
Respawns a player on the coast of their original homeland
Attach one or more modifiers of the specified IDs to the object.
Will add Basic Diplomacy Modifiers to Player Diplomacy for things with a very specific use.
Will block specified actions that a player can do with another player for a fixed number of turns.
This adjusts the maximum number of workers that can work per tile in the specified city.

Changes the investment level with an independent at the modifier object's location by the specified amount. If Set parameter is true, then it will set the using the specified value instead of adjusting.
Adds food to the city after a growth event. The amount is a percentage of the total food required to grow again.
Adjusts the percent discount applied to building maintenance costs, uses efficiency scaling.

Adds a percentage to production for buildings of a specific type or tag based on the amount of a resource slotted in this city. If neither ConstructibleType or Tag are passed in, it will apply to all buildings

Adds a percentage to production for buildings of a specific type or tag based on the amount of a resource slotted in all settlements. If neither ConstructibleType or Tag are passed in, it will apply to all buildings

Adds a percentage to production for buildings of a specific type or tag based on the amount of City-States you are suzerain of. If neither ConstructibleType or Tag are passed in, it will apply to all buildings
This modifier will adjust add Greatwork slot(s) to a constructible or constructibles
This effect adjusts city's growth rate based on the amount of workers/specialists the city has.
This adjusts the local unhappiness of the specified city.
Adds a percent to production when overbuilding.
Increased number of Resources that may be assigned to city.
This effects adjusts a cost multiplier for upgrading the town.
Provides extra yield (typically Gold) from trade routes.
Turn on/off one of the prereqs for this city to generate Treasure Fleets
Applies an unhappiness effect to the subject city
Adjusts specified unit(s) production in cities
Adjusts specified unit(s) production based on the number of resources of specified type slotted in the city
Adjusts specified unit(s) production based on the number of great works
Adjusts specified unit(s) production based on the number of resources of specified type slotted in the city
Adjusts specified unit(s) production based on the number of resources of specified type slotted in ALL cities
This modifier will adjust a yield in a city based on the total of all player owned commander applied promotions.
This modifier will adjust a yield in a city based on the total of all player owned commander levels.
Gives additional yield to the city per great work slotted
Grant a percentage yield to a city that will decay each turn by a set amount, can be scaled
Provides a flat reduction in the specified city yields for each settlement over the cap
This will damage X number of constructibles in the target city
Gives specified yield at player level for specified number of turns.  Yield amount can be negative to incur a cost per turn
Transfer ownership of the target city to the owner of this effect.
Adjusts Great Work slots for a specific constructible.
Game effect to cause war.  Requires a player collection as a target, and the context owner will be the one declaring war.
Apply a yield to a settlement.
Adds Basic Modifier Type/FixedPoint data to a Player - Diplomacy Basic Modifier Array
Give some yield to the starting player and another amount to the target player and all supporters when the effect ends. This amount is usually influenced by the number of envoys.
Can give favors and/or grievances to the initial player and/or their target.
Increase the total number of trade routes that the player can estabish with the target player.
Applies modifiers for a diplomatic project based on if they are supported or not to the initial and target players
Can give favors and/or grievances to the initial player and/or their target.
Increase the total number of trade routes that the player can estabish with the target player.
Allows a description for a project to be generated that supplies information about the Independent and its target.
Additive percentage amount that the rate progress for a project type is modified.  This is scaled by number of envoys if FactorEnvoys is true.  100 is 100%
Change the production of a constructible type in a selected settlement
Change the production of a project in a selected settlement
Applies modifiers for a diplomatic project based on if they are supported or not to the initial and target players
Blocks the base yeilds of all the great works of a target player
Converts the target settlement to the iniator's founded religion
Destroy building type(s) in a settlement. Default only destroys 1, use DestroyAll to destroy all of the type.
Destroy an improvement in a settlement with the selected resource types. Default only destroys 1, use DestroyAll to destroy all of the type.
Disable all workers in a selected settlement for the target player
Grants vision of all commander units to the initator
Spawn a treasure fleet for the initiator
Steal the lowest cost tree node a target has that the initiator does not
For every support envoy a player puts in they get SupportAmount Yield per turn.  For envoys from other players they get Amount
Incorporate a city state into the player empire
Additive percentage amount that the rate progress for a project type is modified.  This is scaled by number of envoys if FactorEnvoys is true.  100 is 100%
Reveals part of the target players map. This is a midfog reveal, not full visibility
Grants vision of all districts within the capital
Give some yield to the starting player and another amount to the target player and all supporters, per turn, usually influenced by the number of envoys.
Applies modifiers for a diplomatic project based on if they are supported or not to the target player
Reveals part of the target players map. This is a midfog reveal, not full visibility
This modifier will adjust a yield in a city based on the relationships with another player
Adds bonus support when a player is the initiator or target of a specific diplomatic action
Adjust support for a diplomatic action per player relationship (or alliance).
Reduce cost of a type of diplomatic action per great work of a specific type.
Reduce cost of a type of diplomatic action per great work of a specific type.
Adjusts specified unit(s) production based on the number of relationships or alliances of specified type
Adjusts specified unit(s) production based on the number of relationships or alliances of specified type
Effect that adjusts player's yield of specified type based on player's diplomatic relationships.
Will modify player relationship when an IP is dispersed.
Checks if relationships between players should change when a war starts.
Will do a relationship change based on WeightType every UpdateFreq number of turns once FirstMeetDelay has passed.
Elevates an independent tribe to a city state. Elevation occurs at the END of the independent's next turn.
Game Effect that awards a Great Work to a player via either of two methods.
Game Effect that awards a Great Work to a player via either of two methods.
Grants yield to the target or initiator when the target supports a diplomatic action
Gives specific experience promotions or promotion points if no promotions are specified.
Gives specific promotions or promotion points if no promotions are specified.
Grants X amount of walls in urban core starting at city center.  Default value is 0.
Prompts sending of a DNA metaprogression event that will complete the specified Challenge.
Prompts sending of a DNA metaprogression event that will progress player's Career Challenge(s).
Adds a GoldenAgeType that can be chosen by the player when a Golden Age triggers, in addition to the ones afforded by their Government.

Adds a debt to the specified yield.  For science/culture this functions as a bucket that needs to be filled before the yield applies normally.  For happiness it lowers lifetime gain.  Culture, Science, Happiness only.
Adjusts how long it takes to extract artifacts
This adjusts the duration of a player's Golden Age
Sets up scoring for any victory that is tracking City-States
Sets up scoring for any victory that is tracking Great Works displayed
Sets up scoring for any victory that is tracking high yield districts created
Sets up scoring for any victory that is tracking natural wonders acquired and their improvements.
Sets up scoring for any victory that is tracking resources assigned
Sets up scoring for any victory that is tracking a count of settlements
Sets up scoring for any victory that is tracking settlements as they are conquered
Sets up scoring for any victory that is tracking units teleported
Sets up scoring for any victory that is tracking wonders created or conquered
If your spies are revealed you do not lose influence per turn
Prevents opposing players from using the Counter Espionage action against this player
This trigger will adjust the population of either smallest or largest settlement that player has whenever the celebration had started.
Adds a research efficiency modifier to progression tree nodes.
Adds to the player settlement cap.
Boosts the number of trade routes this player can have from all other players (or MajorsOnly) by Amount
Gives specified player tradition slots when they start or end a Golden Age.
Adjusts how much additional VP a treasure fleet is worth when captured
Adjusts how many units are created
Adjusts how much gold is awarded from siphoning with a naval unit
Adjusts specified unit(s) production based on the number of great works
Adjusts specified unit(s) production based on a number of another unit type (includes replacements)
Adjusts specified unit(s) production based on the number of resources of specified type slotted in the city
Grants a player level yield when the player becomes suzerain of a city state
Gives specified player level yield as a bonus to narrative rewards.
Gives specified player yield as a bonus when they start a Golden Age.
This modifier will adjust a player's yield based on the total of all player owned commander levels.
This effect is adjusting player's yield (of provided type) based on the number of settlements that the player had conquered from other civilizations.
Adjusts the yield a player gets based on how many settlements they have razed this age
Awards yield for Resources. Turn on ONE boolean parameter (or NONE), but not both.
Gives an amount of player level yield per unique resource the player has
This modifier will adjust a yield in a Player based on the total of all player owned Unit levels.
Provides a flat reduction in the specified player yields for each settlement over the cap
Changes all attribute points gained to be wildcards
Postpones Government selection for the player until this Effect is removed.
Converts a portion of the yield in the TradeYields DB table into a different yield
Destroys the Unit matching the UnitTags (if provided) with the highest level. Ties are broken by having the most experience. Can use flags to further specify priority of considerations.
Additive percentage amount that the action group's projects are modified.  100 is 100%
Additive percentage amount that the rate of accrued favor is modified.  100 is 100%
Adjust if the player has boosted effects from supported diplomatic actions. Individual effects will use this to boost the effet accordingly
Change the maximum number of support allowed when supporting as a third party
Change whether or not to allow levying from all city states, including city states the player is not suzerain of
Change the number of trade routes granted by diplomatic trade agreements
Additive percentage amount that the rate of accrued favor is modified.  100 is 100%
Allow the provided war type to be declared at any time if the player has the required influence.
Give favors and/or grievances to all other players.
Grants the specific attribute nodes specified
Gives a player extra stories at the start of the age.
Can give favors and/or grievances to the initial player and/or their target.
Gives a player charges for free purchases.  Can be used for buildings and/or units. Either a building or unit is required
This effect grants the player a golden age / celebration.
Gives a player a naval unit that has access to an ocean. Provides no unit if there is not a valid plot available
This modifier will place a unit at object's location within 1 more than city radius tiles avoiding units and urban tiles. The main usecase is storylets placing units after city capture.
Grants a unit on Settlement Capture of a specific movement class ONLY ONE INSTANCE OF THIS IS ALLOWED PER PLAYER
Grants victory points for the specified victory type.
Allows the player to purchase wonders
Lowers owner's relationships with all Independpent Powers on the map by one tier.
Gives specified yield at player level for specified number of turns.  Yield amount can be negative to incur a cost per turn
Treasure Fleets are not generated from Resources.
Trading with other civs does not give them Gold
Allows the player to send an Explorer to research the artifacts for this Age.
Removes all constructibles of one type for a player, and replaces them with a different type.
Can give favors and/or grievances to the initial player and/or all major players who share or dont share their same government type.
Sets subject player's government to the stated government type.
Attempt to spawn X tribes near the target player
Can give favors and/or grievances to positive relationship civs based on your target of formal war.
Provides a flat reduction in the specified maintenance yields
Provides extra yields from workers on plots
Adjusts plot yields by an amount or percent per unique improved natural wonder in a player's empire.
This modifier will destroy the discovery at the indicated location
This modifier will place a resource at object's location
Upgrade a town to a city.
Sets the location of a unit to be revealed or hidden. Also reveals or hides other player stealth units
Game effect to reveal everything from another player's map.  Requires a player collection as a target, and the context owner will be the one getting the reveal.
This modifier will grant a player yield based on initiating a command
Heals or damages unit. Amount is direct number to adjust the hit points. Negative for healing, positive for damage
This modifier will grant a player yield based on initiating a Operation
This modifier will adjust a player yield based on a unit. Use requirements to specify the conditions
Adjust the amount to gold to siphon. The negative yield from siphoning comes from a different effect
Thie effects sets whether or not a unit can plunder trade routes between other civs regardless of if the player is at war with any of those civs.
Grants Units to the Player at their Capital City when they trigger a Golden Age
Requirement to verify the specified resources are assigned to the city.
Determine if there is another commander in a commander's radius
Requirement to verify spread of player's founded and/or majority religion to other major players.
Determines if a countdown victory has been won
Determine if the player meets war support requirements in any of their active wars
Has the player achieved a given legacy path milestone?
Determine if a unit adjacent to the subject's plot matches the provided unit type or replacements.
Plot has NUM or more adjacent enemy (combat) units.
Determine if a unit adjacent to the subject's plot matches the provided unit type or replacements.
Test if a plot has any active district.
Test if the conditions for a team legacy victory have been met.
This requirement is always going to be marked as 'met'.  It's useful for debugging.
This requirement is always going to be marked as 'never met'.  It's useful for debugging.
This requirement is always going to be marked as 'not met'.  It's useful for debugging.
Requirement that checks the crisis stage for the current age.
Requirement that checks the age progression total for the current age.
This requirement is met when an newly built constructible in a city has a matching tag with provided tag list.
Check if a city was founded by a specific unit.
Requirment to specify a count of biomes in range.
Requirement to specify a building and various things it must be next to.  The indivdual adjacency arguments are comma separated and all must be adjacent to satisfy that piece of the requirement
This requirement is met when a settlement has smallest population in player's civilization.
This requirement checks to see if a city contains a narutal wonder within its bounds at the moment of transfering it (including founding it).
Requirement to see how many of a route is found in a settlement
Checks if a city has X or more resource slots unfilled.
This requirement checks if a city is the current capital of that civilization.
This requirement checks if a city is the current holy city of that civilization.
Check if a city's center district is at the specified location.
Tests if the owner of this city is on the same team as the owner of the modifier.
Requirement for filtering city acquisitions by type
Determine if a commander has earned a promotion = used a skill point
Determine if a commander has maxed out a specified talent tree, or has maxed out a specified amount of talent trees.
Determine if a commander has earned a specified number of promotions
Returns true if the constructible has at least one Great Work slot.
Requirement that checks if the game is past the initialization phase. Important for something that relies on the world builder file being fully loaded.
Requirement to verify if the Game ended a turn.
Requirement that checks game turn but expects a story subject.  Can be used to set a specific turn, or a turn after a certain amount of time
Checks if a particular legacy path is enabled for a player

Checks that the listed challenges have been completed. Note you have to be logged in as it checks against online metaprogression. This requirement always returns NeverMet in network multiplayer to avoid desyncs.
Requirement for a player being behind number of fully researched techs
Tests if the player is finished with the card play portion of an advanced start or age transition
Checks if the city closest to the subject city is owned by the owner of this effect.
Requirement to return true every time you complete a diplo action.
Requirement to return true every time you complete an espionage action.
Requirement that conquered city has different religion. If different than majority and founded, the expectation is they are the same.
Requirement to verify that the player has conquered a city with a specified wonder
Requirement for handling the most common causes of a player being defeated.
Checks whether the owning player has initiated diplomacy with a specified amount of other major civs.
Determine if a diplomacy independent update action matches the required type
This requirement is met each time when the player has encountered a storylet.
Requirement that checks if a settlement was established by the player
Requirement that checks if the artifact extracted matches location. Expects subject with location
Check if this is the first time a city or town has been captured by this player. Can optionally specify to only apply when capturing a city or only a town. Defaults to both
Requirement to verify the specified story is active.
Requirement that checks the level of investment with the independent
Requirement that checks gossip occurrences to be met.  Be aware of the DynamicEntry and GossipTypes argument descriptions and how they relate
Requirement to verify the player has the specified number of military units.
Requirement to verify the player has circumnavigated the map.
Checks if the player has a city center within X distance of a natural wonder with no improvements constructed by this player on it
Requirement that checks the level of investment with the independent
Requirement to verify that a specific amount of workers have been created.
Requirement to verify the specified number of commanders have a certain number of disciplines maxed out.
Requirement to verify the specified number of commanders have the number of levels.
This requirement tests for if the player has a specific attribute tree and for either if the player had completed that tree (or several trees), or has a given amount of trees in progress.
Requirement to verify how many narrative stories a player has completed.
Requirement to verify relationship status and how many other players they have it with.
Requirement to see if we have unlocked X nodes in Civics/Techs.
Requirement to verify how many narrative stories a player has completed.
Requirement to specify a building has all greatwork slots filled.
Requirement to verify that a player has converted settlements x times.  This is by using the number of times they have dones so with their missionaries.
Checks if the Player has built a Wonder from the Current Age.
Requirement to verify if the player finished a diplomatic action (either sucessfully or not).
Checks the amount of plots the player has revealed. Option to make it repeatable over certain threshold.
Requirement that checks the amount of settlements the player has founded.
This requirements is met when the player has gained any amount of provided type of yield.
Checks if the subject player's Government is the stated government type.
Requirement to check is a Epic Great Work is active.
Requirement to check if subject player has a given IdeologyType.
Checks if the player has an improvement on every natural wonder on the map
Checks if the player has the most number of natural wonder improvements.
Checks if the player has an the most trade routes
Checks if the player has most number of wonders.
Does the player (subject) have the belief (context) as its pantheon?
Requirement to verify that a player has the number of settlements with the specified population.
Requirement to verify that a specific amount of players are trading with you.
Requirement that checks if the specified tradition is active
Determine if a player has a completed unique improvement
Determine if a player has a completed unique quarter
Determine if the player has the required number of alliances
Checks if a player owns at least X infected settlements.
Requirement that checks the amount of masteries the player has reached.
Requirement that checks the amount of resources slotted across all settlements.
Requirement to verify relationship status and how many other players they have it with.
Requirement to verify that you have at least X different religions in your empire.
Requirement to verify that you are trading for or produce the specified resources.
Requirement to verify that x of your settlements are following a religion.
Checks if a player has at least X settlements with their city centers on specified biome types.
Requirement to verify that a specific amount of trade routes another player must have with you.
Requirement to verify that a specific amount of trade routes you have created.
Determine if the player has the required number of wars
Check if player has enough victory points for improvements constructed on wonders to meet this condition
Requirement to verify that a specific amount of workers have been created.
Determine if a dipomatic action response matches the required response
Requirement to check if a player with an ideology is at war with an opposing ideology.
Determine if the attacker in a proposed combat is owned by the contextual player.
Checks if the Player is currently in a Golden Age. Also check for turns in golden age if Turn specified.
Determine if the attacker in a proposed combat is initiating combat
A requirement to check if a player's current active node in a progression tree is one from a list provided.
Requirement that checks a single gossip to met immediately.  Be aware of the DynamicEntry and GossipTypes argument descriptions and how they relate
Is met if the player is over their settlement cap
Requirement that checks the overbuilt building and the replacement building
Requirement that checks the amount of plots the player has revealed.
Returns true if a player has reconquered settlements they lost in the same age at least X times.
Triggers when the provided wonder is built.
Requirement to verify that a player gains a certain number of resources from a single trade route.
Requirement to verify that a matching building is present at both trade endpoints.
Requirement to verify that you are trading for the specified resources.
Requirement to verify that you are trading with two players who are at war with eachother. If amount is set, you must also have that number of trade routes with each of them.
Requirement to verify that you are trading with the specified amount of players.
Requirement to verify that you are trading specified resources.
Requirement to verify that a triggered discovery.  This requirement is expected to be setup with a specific discovery as the context. Has No arguments
Requirement to verify that a matching building is present at both trade endpoints.
Requirement to verify that a matching building is present at both trade endpoints.
Requirement to verify if the player unlocked a civic.
Requirement to verify if the player unlocked a technology.
Requirement that checks victory progress on turn increment.
Is there an adjacent plot that contains the specified Constructible?
Determine if a unit adjacent to the subject's plot matches the provided unit type or replacements.
Checks if the subject plot is within range of a city with at least X resources slotted.
Checks if the subject plot is within range of a constructible with at least X great works slotted.
Checks if a plot is adjacent to a wonder.
Determine if the biome of the subject plot matches the specified biome.
Checks if a plot has a appeal meeting or exceeding a specified amount. If no amount it provided, checks if appeal is greater than zero.
Checks if a plot has a constructible. The specific type of check can be changed using different arguments, which are all mutually exclusive
Determine if the route of the subject plot matches the specified route.
Checks if a plot is considered a Quarter
Determine if distance between plot and capital is within a certain hex range.
This requirement is met when a specialist was assigned to a city by the player.
This requirement is met when a town was upgraded to a city.
Determine if the owner is part of an army with units
Determine if the player has initiated the reinforce army operation
Checks whether the unit is embarked will return true for naval units as well. Use REQUIREMENT_UNIT_DOMAIN_MATCHES to check only for Land Units.
Requirement is met when the player creates a unit.
Requirement is met when the player kills a unit.
Requirement that checks if a unit has units with specified tags and core classes of packed units.

Requirement that checks if a unit has at least a certain amount of packed units, default value is 1. Can include or exclude both combat units and noncombat units from the count, default includes both.
Determine if a unit has earned a specified number of xp
Determine if a unit health total is above or below the provided threshold (inclusive)
Determines if the subject unit is the enemy of the owner of the requirement
Determine if a unit is currently stationed on a district
Checks if a unit is occupying an active district from the specified list
Returns true if the unit has any of the provided tags. If MatchAllTags is set, the unit must match all provided tags.
Triggers when a trade route is created.
This requirement is always going to be marked as 'always met'.  It's useful for debugging.
This requirement set is met if *all* of the inner requirements are met.
This requirement set is met if *any* of the inner requirements are met.
GameEffectArguments: Whether or not the terrain type is valid to move into.
Number of combat units to spawn with the commander.
Number of cities to spawn units near.
Spawn an army near the target city if a camp is not found.
Only apply to specific tribe types if set.
Comma separate list of Unit types to add to the commander.
Comma separate list of Unit tags to add to the commander. The strongest unlocked or the weakest locked will be added.
The string value of the belief yield type. This gets hasehd and then converted to the enum type.
The biome type to apply the BELIEF_YIELD_PER_BIOME yield amount
The yield type to apply with the belief
The terrain type to apply the BELIEF_YIELD_PER_TERRAIN yield amount
The resource type that will act as a multiplier for this effect for each slotted instance of that resource.
The single building type that we want affected by this effect.
The building type to provide the purchase efficency for
The building tag to provide the purchase efficency for
The constructible class to provide the purchase efficency for
The percent purchase efficency to provide
Which unhappiness effect it ties to
The name a TAG that the constructible must have to be allowed to be purchased by a town.
Makes both Coastal Raiding and Pillaging 1 movement. Be careful if multiple game effects apply to something and are removeable; removing either of them will turn UseAdvancedPillage off.
Makes both Coastal Raiding and Pillaging 0 movement
Allow you to pillage and coastal raid at a farther distance. Set it to 2 if you want to pillage/coastal raid 2 tiles away.
Does this unit have a chance to capture defeated enemies?
Type of unit created after capture
Is this unit always captured when defeated?
The tag of the enemy unit type that this unit always captures
Combat strength bonus adjustment for only the next attack after killing a unit
When set to true, the unit no longer accrues resource maintenance.
If only enemy units are counted
If only friendly units are counted
The unit type to provide the purchase efficency for
The percent purchase efficency to provide
The integer percent value of resistance to damage from a WMD blast.
The integer percent value of resistance to damage from WMD fallout.
The integer percent value of resistance to damage from water
If true, only grants the bonus if the owning player is the one declaring war, if false, only grants the bonus if the owning player is being declared on.
If true, only grants the bonus if both the owning player and target player have founded a Religion.
Which yield type will get modified.
If set, only players in the homelands will be set to have met each other
The ID of the respawn modifiers to instantiate from the AgeTransitionRespawnItems table
Wether or not to have the system give the player a new starting location
If the player is getting a new starting location, wether it should be on their homeland or not
Holds the name of the modifier using the gameeffect.  Currently just for Agendas.
Used as the Notification Message LOC String.
Used as the Notification Summary LOC String.
The Basic Modifier enum for the first value
The first numeric value paired with the first type
The Basic Modifier enum for the second value
The second numeric value paired with the second type
The Basic Modifier enum for the third value
The third numeric value paired with the thrid type
The number of turns the player won't be able to do the action group type actions with the other player.

How many of the listed gossips must have occurred for the requirement to be met.  Functions as an and/or manipulation

A turn window in which the gossips must have occurred for the requirement to be met. The earliest gossip occurrence and the last must be within that turn window.  Default -1 means it isn't considered.

Some gossips have a tile location where it occurred.  This sets a max distance of where two gossips must have occurred in order to be met.  If there are more than two gossips in the requirement, this will not check and will always be not met.  Default -1 means it isn't considered.
Sets a turn requirement.  Gossip occurrences before the turn set will not be considered. If used with AfterInit, the higher of the two will be used instead
Sets a turn requirement.  Gossip occurrences before the story was initialized will not be considered.  If used with AfterTurn, the higher of the two will be used instead

Comma separated list of gossips to check against.  Each of these gossips becomes a new argument that can be used to provide additional parameters for the gossip.  This does expect two additional characters at the end to allow for duplicate gossip types with different parameters. eg If you want to check two GOSSIP_PILLAGE, enter GOSSIP_PILLAGE01 and GOSSIP_PILLAGE02.  The two additional characters must always be entered, regardless of duplicates or amount.

Dynamic Entry is not actually the argument type.  Each of the entries in GossipTypes can be used as their own argument.  The value is a comma separated list for parameters to check against, but each parameter comes in sets of 3: value specifier, parameter key, parameter value. Value specifier is Hash or Numeric, indicating how to treat the third of the triplet.  Parameter key is one of the parameters of the gossip, and value is the value to check against. Example - Hash,ConstructibleType,BUILDING_LIBRARY,Numeric,AdjacencyBonus,3
When using 1 gossip requirement, how many of the same gossip must be met. Error to use multiple entries.
Uses TAG vocabulary.  Tag can specify a number of units. Do not use with UnitType, UnitClass, or DomainType
Max distance settlement center must be to untouched wonder for validity
Victory points needed to meet requirement (a.k.a achieve this victory)
Victory points per new settlement created near untouched wonder
Victory points achieved per turn for meeting requirement
True for if you own the settlement, false if city is revolting in your favour
The required number of maxed disciplines per commander.
How many commanders need the number of maxed disciplines.
How many commanders need the number of promotions.
What type of commanders to look at
The type of the tree to see if it was completed.
The amount of trees to see if they were completed.
The amount of trees to see that are currently in progress.
How many actions have been completed. If both Amount and PlayerAmount are set it is an error.
How many players completed 1 action with. If both Amount and PlayerAmount are set it is an error.
The diplomacy action group. If not set will be all action types.
How many nodes must we have unlocked?
Do we only care about Civics nodes?
Do we only care about Tech nodes?
Do we only count Mastered nodes?
Is our question really 'have we finished the tree'?
The constructible to check against if filled.
How many great works it should be filled with, if unused will default to max for the constructible
If true, it only counts the players settlements
If true, it only counts the players settlements
If true, it only counts settlements on distant lands
The amount of plots revealed on which the requirement is met
Whether the requirement is met every time the threshold is met
The amount of settlements founded on which the requirement is met
Whether the requirement only counts settled towns (via Settlers) towards the amount
Whether the requirement only counts settled cities (via Founders) towards the amount
The type of the yield that player has to gain in order to meet this requirement.
The name of an event that we need to send the dynamic progress data to.
The government type to check for.
The great work to check for.
The type of ideology we are checking for.
If this is true, this requirement will be met if the player has any ideology. Overrides the IdeologyType argument.
The type of improvement that gets fertilized by random event
The type of improvement that gets fertilized by random event
The amount of unique trade partners required to trade with player
If true, checks active tradition only at start of golden age. Defaults to false
Set Value to the enum for the improvement or set to NO_IMPROVEMENT if want to check presence of ANY unique improvement
Set Value to the enum for the quarter or set to NO_QUARTER if want to check presence of ANY unique quarter
How many other players must you have alliances with?
Are we unmet when you have more than this many alliances?
Will we trigger more than once?
Must you have an alliance with all Majors?
If AllMajors, is it okay if some have died?
Only count Players in the Foreign Hemisphere?
Only count Players in the Home Hemisphere?

Whether the requirement only counts cultural masteries reached towards the amount
Whether the requirement only counts technological masteries reached towards the amount
The resource class type, such as RESOURCECLASS_FACTORY

Only count Players in the Foreign Hemisphere?
Only count Players in the Home Hemisphere?
The required number of different religions.
The religions must be the majority in a city.
Which resources to check the player has.  Can be a comma separated list.
Which resources to check the player has.
The required number of settlements that must follow a religion. Defaults to all settlements.
If true, the cities must follow a religion you founded. Defaults to true
If true, only counts settlements in distant lands.
A list of biome types, if multiple biome types are given the count will include settlements in both types.

The required number of trade routes established

Is this boost to land routes or sea routes

Victory points needed to fulfill this requirement
Victory points achieved for every improvement built on a natural wonder tile
Victory points achieved per turn for built natural wonder improvements
To specify a specific opposing ideology.
Whether the requirement is met every time the threshold is met
A list of progression tree node types to check for. Assumes that all of the provided nodes are from the same progression tree.
A specific node depth to check for. All provided nodes are checked for the same depth level.

Dynamic Entry is not actually the argument type.  The entry in GossipTypes is used as its own argument.  The value is a comma separated list for parameters to check against, but each parameter comes in sets of 3: value specifier, parameter key, parameter value. Value specifier is Hash or Numeric, indicating how to treat the third of the triplet.  Parameter key is one of the parameters of the gossip, and value is the value to check against. Example - Hash,ConstructibleType,BUILDING_LIBRARY,Numeric,AdjacencyBonus,3
The constructible replacing the old one
The player is the origianl owner of the settlement
Overbuilding doesn't track improvements, but this will allow it.  Not compatible with NewCosntructibleType.
The amount of plots revealed on which the requirement is met
The number of times a player must have reconquered a settlement they lost in the same age.
Whether to trigger on building any wonder.
The required number of resources gained from a trade route
The building both endpoints must have.
Which resource to check for trading.  Can be a comma separated list.
The number of trade routes to have with each of the players.
The amount of unique trade partners required.  If amount and percent not specified it is every major player
The percent of alive players to trade with. If amount and percent not specified it is every major player
Which resource to check for trading.  Can be a comma separated list.
Uses TAG vocabulary.  Tag can specify a number of units. Do not use with UnitType, UnitClass, or DomainType
Uses TAG vocabulary.  Tag can specify a number of units. Do not use with UnitType, UnitClass, or DomainType
The count of first placed victories to achieve
The victory class type to check
The minimum place required to be met, or if specific, the exact place that needs to be met
Wether the place needs to be exact, or at a minimum
The minimum progress required to be met, as an int
Whether to check progress as a percentage or not, e.g. 50 for 50%. Default is true
The unit type to match against.  Includes replacement types but not base types.
Whether or not to include the center hex.
If true, only looks for cities owned by the owner of the plot being checked.  If false, only looks for cities not owned by the owner of the plot being checked.
The amount of resources that must be slotted in the adjacent cities to qualify.
If true, only looks for constructibles owned by the owner of the plot being checked.  If false, only looks for constructibles not owned by the owner of the plot being checked.
The amount of great works that must be slotted in the adjacent constructible to qualify.
The constructible class that counts, e.g. buildings
If true, only looks for wonders owned by the plot owner.  If false, only looks for wonders not owned by the plot owner.
Amount to meet or exceed to for the requirement to return true. This is ignored if UseAppealHappinessThreshold is set to true.
Uses the APPEAL_FOR_HAPPINESS_TILE_YIELD() value set in Global Parameters as the Amount.
The specific constructible to check for
The constructible tag to check for
The age of the building to check for
Can be used with the preceding arguments to check how many applicable constructibles are in the plot. Greater than the count returns true
Checks if the plot is adjacent to a navigable river. Can only be used with ConstructibleType
Reinforcement calls count during a single war.
Comma separated unit tags that a unit has to pack
Comma separated unit core classes that a unit has to pack
The minimum number of packed units to check for
Whether or not to count combat units
Whether or not to count noncombat units
Whether to only check the owner's units or all units.
If the unit is garrisoned, the district has active fortifcations, such as walls
The required district type. All types are included if this is empty
Is it required that the player owns the district?
A list of the district types to check for. Requirement will be met if unit is occupying any of those types
Wether or not to only check for districts in friendly territory
A comma separated list of tags to match with the unit.
Set true if the unit must match all supplied tags. Default behavior is that only one provided tag needs to match.
